Simon Robb for Metro.co.uk Sunday 5 Feb 2017 8:26 am Might want to freeze your broccoli supply (Picture: Getty/Metro) 
First it was our courgettes and then lettuce. but little did we know that was just the tip of the iceberg (sorry) â€“ now broccoli is off the menu. Boy, five, dies after choking on his food during his lunch break at school 
Supermarkets like Tesco, Sainsburyâ€™s and Morrisons are rationing broccoli â€“ with some only offering three heads of the vegetable per customer. 
Earlier this week, shoppers were faced with empty produce shelves as they tried to snatch the reaming lettuces. Empty shelves at a Tesco store as UK the brunt of the veg crisis (Picture: PA/Rob Gregory) 
And these shortages have affected other seasonal veg like courgettes, white salad peppers and cabbage. 
A notice on an empty Tesco shelve read: â€˜Due to continued weather problems in Spain there is a shortage of iceberg lettuce.

But why has this happened? 
A cold snap across Europe has led to poor growing condition, mostly in Italy and Spain where much of the vegetable stock is imported from. 
This is down to a combination of frosty weather, flooding and a lack of light. 
Murcia in Spain supplies around 80% of Europeâ€™s vegetables, but the city has suffered its heaviest rainfall in 30 years. 
Buyers are now looking to import from the US and Egypt, but the added distance makes the produce more pricey. Tesco limits iceberg lettuce sales to three per person. https://t.co/u5QhjFKs4F pic.twitter.com/mZ8MfrebLz

â€˜We have therefore had a cap on sales of broccoli and iceberg lettuce to ensure we maintain good supplies for our regular customers.
